intro: Isoloba recurva, commonly known as the zigzag plant, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Isoloba recurva is well adapted to withstand drought conditions due to its thick, waxy leaves that store water.
